name: SaaS Subscription Agreement
description: Comprehensive B2B SaaS subscription terms covering service levels, data processing, liability, and termination

clauses.body_md:
# SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT

**AGREEMENT DATE:** {{date}}

**BETWEEN:**

**(1) {{provider_name}}**, a company incorporated in {{provider_jurisdiction}} with registered address at {{provider_address}} (the "**Provider**"); and

**(2) {{customer_name}}**, a company incorporated in {{customer_jurisdiction}} with registered address at {{customer_address}} (the "**Customer**").

**BACKGROUND:**

The Provider has developed and operates a software-as-a-service platform (the "**Service**"). The Customer wishes to subscribe to and use the Service on the terms set out in this Agreement.

clauses.title: 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
clauses.body_md:
1.1 In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires:

**"Authorised Users"** means the Customer's employees, agents, and independent contractors who are authorised to use the Service under this Agreement.

**"Confidential Information"** means all confidential information (however recorded or preserved) disclosed by a party or its representatives to the other party, including but not limited to technical data, trade secrets, know-how, business plans, customer lists, and financial information.

**"Customer Data"** means all data, content, and materials that the Customer or Authorised Users submit, upload, or transmit to or through the Service.

**"Documentation"** means the user guides, manuals, and help materials relating to the Service as made available by the Provider.

**"Initial Term"** means the period of {{commitment_term_months}} months from the Service Commencement Date.

**"Intellectual Property Rights"** means all patents, rights to inventions, utility models, copyright and related rights, trade marks, service marks, trade, business and domain names, rights in trade dress or get-up, rights in goodwill or to sue for passing off, unfair competition rights, rights in designs, rights in computer software, database rights, topography rights, moral rights, rights in confidential information (including know-how and trade secrets) and any other intellectual property rights, in each case whether registered or unregistered and including all applications for and renewals or extensions of such rights, and all similar or equivalent rights or forms of protection in any part of the world.

**"Personal Data"**, **"Data Controller"**, **"Data Processor"**, and **"processing"** have the meanings given to them in the Data Protection Legislation.

**"Service Commencement Date"** means {{date}} or such other date as the parties agree in writing.

**"Subscription Fees"** means the fees payable by the Customer for the Service as set out in Clause 5.

**"Subscription Term"** means the Initial Term and any Renewal Terms.

clauses.title: 2. SERVICE PROVISION
3. SERVICE LEVELS
4. CUSTOMER OBLIGATIONS
5. FEES AND PAYMENT
6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
clauses.body_md:
6.1 **Provider's IP**: The Customer acknowledges that all Intellectual Property Rights in the Service, Documentation, and any materials created or provided by the Provider belong to the Provider (or its licensors). Nothing in this Agreement transfers any such rights to the Customer.

6.2 **Customer Data IP**: As between the parties, the Customer retains all Intellectual Property Rights in Customer Data. The Customer grants the Provider a non-exclusive, worldwide licence to use, copy, store, transmit, and display Customer Data solely to the extent necessary to provide the Service and perform the Provider's obligations under this Agreement.

6.3 **Feedback**: If the Customer provides any suggestions, ideas, or feedback regarding the Service ("**Feedback**"), the Provider may use such Feedback without any obligation to the Customer, and the Customer hereby assigns all rights in such Feedback to the Provider.

6.4 **Aggregated Data**: The Provider may collect and analyse anonymised, aggregated data relating to the use of the Service for the purposes of improving the Service, generating industry insights, and other business purposes. Such anonymised data shall not identify the Customer or any individual.

clauses.title: 7. CONFIDENTIALITY
8. DATA PROTECTION
clauses.body_md:
8.1 **Applicability**: This Clause 8 applies to the extent that the Provider processes Personal Data on behalf of the Customer in providing the Service.

8.2 **Roles**: The parties acknowledge that:

   (a) the Customer is a Data Controller in respect of Personal Data contained in Customer Data; and
   
   (b) the Provider is a Data Processor acting on behalf of the Customer.

8.3 **Data Processing Terms**: The Provider shall process Personal Data in accordance with:

   (a) the Customer's documented instructions as set out in this Agreement (and as otherwise notified by the Customer from time to time);
   
   (b) applicable Data Protection Legislation; and
   
   (c) {{#if data_processing_required}}the Data Processing Addendum attached as Schedule 1{{else}}the Provider's Data Processing Agreement available at [URL]{{/if}}.

8.4 **Data Subject Rights**: The Provider shall, at the Customer's cost, provide reasonable assistance to enable the Customer to respond to requests from data subjects exercising their rights under Data Protection Legislation.

8.5 **Security**: The Provider shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect Personal Data against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction, or damage, as described in Schedule [●].

8.6 **Sub-Processors**: The Customer consents to the Provider engaging third-party sub-processors to process Personal Data, provided that:

   (a) the Provider maintains a list of sub-processors at [URL];
   
   (b) the Provider notifies the Customer of any new sub-processor at least [30 days] in advance; and
   
   (c) the Customer may object to a new sub-processor on reasonable data protection grounds, in which case the Provider shall use reasonable efforts to accommodate the objection or the Customer may terminate the affected service.

8.7 **Data Breaches**: The Provider shall notify the Customer without undue delay (and in any event within [48 hours]) upon becoming aware of any Personal Data breach affecting Customer Data.

8.8 **Data Return/Deletion**: On termination of this Agreement, the Provider shall (at the Customer's election) return or securely delete all Personal Data, except to the extent required to be retained by law.

clauses.title: 9. WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMERS
10. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
11. TERM AND TERMINATION
clauses.body_md:
11.1 **Initial Term**: This Agreement shall commence on the Service Commencement Date and continue for the Initial Term of {{commitment_term_months}} months.

11.2 **Renewal**: After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive {{#if_equals billing_frequency "monthly"}}monthly{{else}}annual{{/if_equals}} periods (each a "**Renewal Term**") unless either party gives the other at least {{notice_period_days}} days' written notice of non-renewal before the end of the then-current term.

11.3 **Termination for Breach**: Either party may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect by written notice if:

   (a) the other party commits a material breach of this Agreement and (if capable of remedy) fails to remedy such breach within [30 days] of receiving written notice specifying the breach; or
   
   (b) the other party commits a material breach that is not capable of remedy.

11.4 **Termination for Insolvency**: Either party may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect by written notice if the other party:

   (a) becomes insolvent or unable to pay its debts as they fall due;
   
   (b) enters into liquidation, administration, receivership, or any similar insolvency proceeding; or
   
   (c) ceases or threatens to cease carrying on business.

11.5 **Termination for Convenience**: [The Customer may terminate this Agreement for convenience on [90 days'] written notice to the Provider, subject to payment of all Subscription Fees due for the remainder of the then-current term.]

11.6 **Effect of Termination**: On termination or expiry of this Agreement:

   (a) all rights granted to the Customer under this Agreement shall immediately cease;
   
   (b) the Customer shall immediately cease all use of the Service and shall not attempt to access it;
   
   (c) each party shall (at the other party's request) return or securely destroy all Confidential Information of the other party in its possession;
   
   (d) the Provider shall (at the Customer's election) return Customer Data in a commonly used format or securely delete it within [30 days], except to the extent required to be retained by law;
   
   (e) all outstanding Subscription Fees and other amounts due shall become immediately payable; and
   
   (f) termination shall not affect any rights or obligations that have accrued prior to termination.

11.7 **Survival**: Clauses [1 (Definitions), 5.4 (Late Payment for amounts accrued), 6 (Intellectual Property), 7 (Confidentiality), 8.8 (Data Return), 10 (Liability), 11.6 (Effect of Termination), 11.7 (Survival), and 13 (General)] shall survive termination of this Agreement.

clauses.title: 12. GENERAL PROVISIONS
clauses.body_md:
12.1 **Entire Agreement**: This Agreement (including any schedules and the documents referred to in it) constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all previous agreements, understandings, and representations relating to its subject matter.

12.2 **Variation**: No variation of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by both parties.

12.3 **Waiver**: No failure or delay by a party in exercising any right or remedy shall constitute a waiver of that right or remedy. A waiver of any breach shall not constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach.

12.4 **Severability**: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, that provision shall be deemed severed and the validity, legality, and enforceability of the remaining provisions shall not be affected.

12.5 **Assignment**: The Customer may not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the Provider's prior written consent. The Provider may assign this Agreement to any affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets on written notice to the Customer.

12.6 **No Partnership**: Nothing in this Agreement shall create or be deemed to create a partnership, joint venture, agency, or employment relationship between the parties.

12.7 **Third-Party Rights**: No person other than the parties to this Agreement shall have any right to enforce any term of this Agreement.

12.8 **Notices**: All notices under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by email or registered post to the addresses set out in this Agreement or as otherwise notified. Notices shall be deemed received: (a) if by email, on transmission (provided no delivery failure notification is received); or (b) if by post, [3 business days] after posting.

12.9 **Force Majeure**: Neither party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performing its obligations (other than payment obligations) to the extent such failure or delay is caused by circumstances beyond its reasonable control, including acts of God, natural disasters, war, terrorism, riots, pandemics, government actions, internet failures, or failures of third-party hosting or telecommunications providers.

12.10 **Counterparts**: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which when executed shall constitute an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

clauses.title: 13. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
clauses.body_md:
13.1 This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter shall be governed by and construed in accordance with {{governing_law_text}}.

13.2 The parties irrevocably agree that {{venue_text}} shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter.

clauses.title: EXECUTED AS AN AGREEMENT
clauses.body_md:

metadata.compliance_notes: B2B SaaS agreement. Ensure data protection terms comply with GDPR/UK GDPR/local DPLs. Liability caps subject to reasonableness under local law. Consumer contracts would require significant modifications.
